Trade/Device Name(s): Gamma Phage Lysis Assay For The Identification Of Bacillus Anthracis
Gamma Phage Lysis for the Identification of Bacillus anthracis
Submitter Information: Office of Surgeon General, Department of Army
Specimen Type(s): Non-hemolytic, aerobic, gram-positive, “ground-glass”-appearing colonies from sheep blood agar
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Gamma Phage Lysis Assay to identify Bacillus anthracis using a lytic phage method
Indications for Use Summary: Used with suspect colonies from sheep blood agar and other markers/testing for identification of Bacillus anthracis; not for screening blood or plasma donors; limited to designated LRN and DoD laboratories
